lines.text: [O.C. and Stiggs are at Lenora Schwab's wedding and are fooling with the Uzi they gave as a present.]
Hey, whatcha got?
Randall, how would you like to have more fun than you've ever had in your life?
I don't know. I've had a lot of fun. I have Legos, you know.
I dunno about this, Stiggs. That goon has a gun!
It's OK! He's crazy!

[talking about the car dealer, Ms. Bunny]
It was the last case that gramps had before he retired... she got off with a hung jury.
They hung the whole jury?

[specifying the Gila Monster car to Ms Bunny]
OK, Ms. Bunny! Number 1, we want zero miles to the gallon.
Right. No MPGs. It has to be a vulgarlay inefficient mode of trasnportation.
Loud, real loud. It has to generate a terrifyingly seismic field of noise. If we could combine really loud noise with the ugliness of poverty, we'd have the ideal car.
...making people think that you're poor, so they know you've got nothing to loose if they crash into your car....
the acropolis.
Ah, yes. Driving this car right in the acropolis should be completely horrifying to every civilized guy on earth.

[speaking to Sponson about what wedding gift to buy for Lenore Schwab]
She's real frail and introverted, she likes to dance to ballet and play her harp. We thought she'd be happier with a... machine gun.
Oliver, is it? Oliver Cromwell Ogilvy.
Uh, just O.C.'s fine.
It stands for "Out of Control".
Here, blow the place.
[hands him a grenade]
This is re... This is real!
Yeah, everything gets to be sooner or later.
Hey, you know, you guys better have badges.
Badges? Badges? We don't have no stinkin' badges. We got souvenirs. You wanna buy some goodies? Machetes? Come again, amigo. Top discount.
This is the life, isn't it? I wonder what the poor people are doing tonight.
[scoffs]
I know where 624 of them will be on Monday morning. Workin' for me. In my sweatshop.
[toasting]
To Mexico.
So, what do you, like, do?
Basically, I drink. And I make a lot of money.
I mean, what kind of work do you do, that you *can* do, really wasted?
Hog couture, boys.
Hog couture? How's that?
I manufacture clothes for fat women.
[last lines]

[meeting his new nurse]
Hey, if you're gonna be hanging around the house, I need to know two things.
What are those?
Can you make huevos rancheros?
Oh, I can manage that.
Good. Now, what's your story on menopause, huh?
I always pause for men, Harry.
